title.narrative: 2.2. JUSTICE SYSTEM CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Improved capacity of judicial system to detect, investigate and prosecute the crimes against children, especially the crimes against girls and adolescent girls., which contributes to Access To Justice, Justice For Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2019, girls and boys benefit from and access decentralized child protection mechanisms and programmes that prevent and protect them from violation of rights, primarily violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect.

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved capacity of judicial system to detect, investigate and prosecute the crimes against children, especially the crimesagainst girls and adolescent girls.

description.narrative: In 2021, increasing specialisation of judicial officials, prosecutors and police was critical and, using; virtual methodologies, more public officials were reached than initially foreseen. Over 1,400 National Civil Police investigators were trained, two modules were implemented for 560 judges, and 90 judges dealing with femicide were trained to appropriately deal with child victims and witnesses.; Some 230 members of multidisciplinary court teams were trained, a module on sexual violence was developed to train judicial and hospital staff focused on women, and a model was developed for case registry and follow up, linking prosecutors and child protection services.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/01/2022
